title: Addresses General
text: Definition The address data management offers a maximum of flexibility. A data structure has been developed that is somewhat out of the ordinary in terms of the "conventional" idea of how an address database is set up. With DdD Cowis backoffice, you can not only create any type of address type (supplier, customer, employee, private), but also store any number of telephone numbers, fax numbers, contact persons and different addresses for each address. Furthermore, various data can be transferred to DdD Cowis pos or DdD Cowis order processing. Call To enter the address data management, select the "Addresses" item in the main menu. Now a list of the following address data is displayed: Address ID, name, postal code, city, etc..
description:
Definition

 The address data management offers a maximum of flexibility. A data structure has been developed that is somewhat out of the ordinary in terms of the "conventional" idea of how an address database is set up. With DdD Cowis backoffice, you can not only create any type of address type (supplier, customer, employee, private), but also store any number of telephone numbers, fax numbers, contact persons and different addresses for each address.

 Furthermore, various data can be transferred to DdD Cowis pos or DdD Cowis order processing.

Call

To enter the address data management, select the "Addresses" item in the main menu. Now a list of the following address data is displayed: Address ID, name, postal code, city, etc..

title: Analysis - Receipt of goods date
text: it specifically concerns the possibility of recording the last goods receipt date (regardless of the evaluation/analysis). This date is "dangerous" because it CAN lead to incorrect interpretation of the numbers. What does this date do? Let's assume we have an item that was delivered on the following dates: 03.10.20 50 pieces 30.05.21 50 pieces 30.09.21 200 pieces So, we received a total of 100 pieces during the period from 01.10.20 to 31.05.21. Let's assume we create an evaluation from 01.10.20 to 31.05.21 (and with the date ONLY on the first page). Then, the delivered 100 pieces will also be displayed. If I now repeat the date on the item selection page as 'Last goods receipt date,' The result is as follows, And now everyone thinks, 'Yes, I haven't received any deliveries of that item.' Exactly. However, because we specified on the item selection page that the 'Last goods receipt date' must be between 01.10.20 and 31.05.21, Cowis does not consider the item at all. This applies not only to the deliveries but also to the sales. If anything, one could argue that the date on the item selection can also be set up to the current date, but I am more inclined to omit it altogether.

The result is as follows,


 

And now everyone thinks, 'Yes, I haven't received any deliveries of that item.'


Exactly.


 

 

However, because we specified on the item selection page that the 'Last goods receipt date' must be between 01.10.20 and 31.05.21, Cowis does not consider the item at all.


This applies not only to the deliveries but also to the sales.


If anything, one could argue that the date on the item selection can also be set up to the current date, but I am more inclined to omit it altogether.

title: Backoffice Computer Maintenance
text: If a Cowis custoer is using Remote DFÜ, and he is updating his Backoffice system, Cowis will always place a Update for the POS in the transmit folder of the named POS (like K0011\transmit\) Over time, there might be more than 20 or 30 updates in the trasmit folder, which will never be transfered to the POS. If you are working on the COWIS BO System, and the customer is using Remote DFÜ, just have a quick look in the transmit folder of the POS and delete the stored updates.

title: Create settlement period, cash transaction
text: The following steps are taught but cannot be found in the manual or the DdD Knowledge Database for the customer: Cowis -> Cash register closures -> Extras -> Cash transactions income & expenses -> Edit. Select the corresponding cash register; then the overview of settlement periods will open. "New" -> Enter a name for the period -> Enter "From" and "To" dates (ideally 1 month) -> Press the "Enter" key until "Create another record?" appears -> Answer with "No." Double-click on the created period and click "Yes" in the subsequent pop-up window. The receipts will now be processed, which can take several minutes, visible in the line below. After processing is complete, a window will open -> Click "Back." Cowis -> Cash register closures -> Extras -> Cash transactions income & expenses -> Close period -> Ok -> Yes. Confirm the settlement number. Close the print preview. Answer "Yes" without fail to "Do you want to print now?" Otherwise, the settlement period must be approved by us. Confirm any subsequent questions/pop-up windows with "Yes." The settlement period is now closed, as indicated by an "A" in the first field of the overview. "" means that the settlement period has been created but is not yet closed. If neither "A" nor "" is displayed, the settlement period is pending approval and must be approved by us. Completed settlement periods can also be found in the Fibu interface via the Cowis main menu.
description:
The following steps are taught but cannot be found in the manual or the DdD Knowledge Database for the customer:

  1. Cowis -> Cash register closures -> Extras -> Cash transactions income & expenses -> Edit.



  1. Select the corresponding cash register; then the overview of settlement periods will open.

  2. "New" -> Enter a name for the period -> Enter "From" and "To" dates (ideally 1 month) -> Press the "Enter" key until "Create another record?" appears -> Answer with "No."

  3. Double-click on the created period and click "Yes" in the subsequent pop-up window.

  4. The receipts will now be processed, which can take several minutes, visible in the line below.

  5. After processing is complete, a window will open -> Click "Back."

  6. Cowis -> Cash register closures -> Extras -> Cash transactions income & expenses -> Close period -> Ok -> Yes.

  7. Confirm the settlement number.

  8. Close the print preview.

  9. Answer "Yes" without fail to "Do you want to print now?" Otherwise, the settlement period must be approved by us.

  10. Confirm any subsequent questions/pop-up windows with "Yes."

The settlement period is now closed, as indicated by an "A" in the first field of the overview. "" means that the settlement period has been created but is not yet closed. If neither "A" nor "" is displayed, the settlement period is pending approval and must be approved by us.


Completed settlement periods can also be found in the Fibu interface via the Cowis main menu.

title: Error message: No response
EDI Problems - customers with a GMAIL Account / EDI E-Mail Probleme - Kunden mit GMAIL Account
text: UK: recently, some customers have informed us that they are not receiving EDI data. Affected are customers with a mailbox from the provider GMAIL / formerly GOOGLEMAIL, just like you. Reason: Since 30.05.2022 Google prohibits the use of Gmail with external programs To better protect your account, as of May 30, 2022, Google will no longer support third-party apps or devices where your username and password are sufficient to log in to your Google account. Important: This deadline does not apply to customers of Google Workspace or Google Cloud Identity. The effective date of this policy for these customers will be announced in the Workspace Blog at a later date. It turned out that this change was first made on June 7, i.e. from June 7, these mailboxes will not work. We hereby ask you to contact your ERP partner and create a new EDI e-mail address for the EDI data exchange (no longer from GMAIL). Please give us a new EDI e-mail address and then let us know if and when we should send EDI data again. Thank you very much. For further questions, I am available by phone in the morning at Tel.: 0221 921509-12, otherwise please send an e-mail. Best regards Sabine Hamacher BTE Clearing-Center DE: in letzter Zeit haben uns einige Kunden mitgeteilt, dass Sie keine EDI-Daten erhalten. Betroffen sind Kunden mit einem Mailpostfach vom Provider GMAIL/ ehemals GOOGLEMAIL, so wie Sie. Grund: Seit 30.05.2022 verbietet Google die Nutzung von Gmail mit externen Programmen Zum besseren Schutz Ihres Kontos unterstützt Google ab dem 30. Mai 2022 keine Drittanbieter-Apps oder -Geräte mehr, bei denen Ihr Nutzername und Passwort ausreichen, um sich in Ihrem Google-Konto anzumelden. Wichtig: Diese Frist gilt nicht für Kunden von Google Workspace oder Google Cloud Identity. Das Datum des Inkrafttretens dieser Richtlinie für diese Kunden wird zu einem späteren Zeitpunkt im Workspace-Blog angekündigt. Es hat sich herausgestellt, dass diese Änderung erst am 7. Juni vorgenommen wurde, d.h. ab dem 7 Juni funktionieren diese Postfächer nicht. Hiermit bitten wir Sie sich mit Ihrem Warenwirtschaftspartner in Verbindung zu setzen und für den EDI-Datenaustausch eine neue EDI-Mailadresse anzulegen (nicht mehr von GMAIL). Bitte benennen Sie uns eine neue EDI-Mailadresse und teilen uns dann noch mit, ob und ab wann wir EDI Daten nochmals senden sollen. Vielen lieben Dank. Für Rückfragen stehe ich Ihnen telefonisch Vormittags unter Tel.: 0221 921509-12 zur Verfügung, ansonsten gerne per Mail. Mit freundlichen Grüßen Sabine Hamacher BTE Clearing-Center Alternative ist ein GMX Account
description:
UK: 

recently, some customers have informed us that they are not receiving EDI data.

Affected are customers with a mailbox from the provider GMAIL / formerly GOOGLEMAIL, just like you.

 

Reason:

 

Since 30.05.2022 Google prohibits the use of Gmail with external programs

To better protect your account, as of May 30, 2022, Google will no longer support third-party apps or devices where your username and password are sufficient to log in to your Google account.

Important: This deadline does not apply to customers of Google Workspace or Google Cloud Identity. The effective date of this policy for these customers will be announced in the Workspace Blog at a later date.

 

It turned out that this change was first made on June 7, i.e. from June 7, these mailboxes will not work.

 

We hereby ask you to contact your ERP partner and create a new EDI e-mail address for the EDI data exchange (no longer from GMAIL).

 

Please give us a new EDI e-mail address and then let us know if and when we should send EDI data again.

 

Thank you very much.

 

For further questions, I am available by phone in the morning at Tel.: 0221 921509-12, otherwise please send an e-mail.

 

Best regards

 

Sabine Hamacher

BTE Clearing-Center

title: Fiskaly error
text: When this error message shows up during a sale on the POS: Check if TSE has been testet. If not, then run the test. That usually works. If it still doesn't work, (and the PC runs Windows 7), then it could be the .NET Framework, that isn't the right version. Download .NET Framework 4.5.2 for offline installation and install it on the POS Download Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5.2 (Offline Installer) for Windows Vista SP2, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2008 SP2, Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 from Official Microsoft Download Center
description:
1. When this error message shows up during a sale on the POS: 

 

 

  1. Check if TSE has been testet. If not, then run the test. That usually works. 

 

  1. If it still doesn't work, (and the PC runs Windows 7), then it could be the .NET Framework, that isn't the right version. Download .NET Framework 4.5.2 for offline installation and install it on the POS

 

 

Download Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5.2 (Offline Installer) for Windows Vista SP2, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2008 SP2, Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 from Official Microsoft Download Center

title: KIS (Kundeninformationssystem (CIS Customer Information System) Birthday Voucher TV
text: KIS (Kundeninformationssystem (CIS Customer Information System) Birthday Voucher TV 18 August 2022 10:13 Table of Content Cowis offers the so-called HIS (Customer Information System) as an optional module. With this, a variety of evaluations are possible. But also customer loyalty programs with bonus vouchers and vouchers for birthdays, for example. Birthday voucher We click on addresses and start a selection for the desired date range Selection or F3 Für example Then all addresses are marked Extras -> sonstiges -> Bonussystem -> Neu You enter the amount of the voucher and the number of vouchers per customer Than we click on berechnen If this is ok , you can create the vouchers by clicking on GUT eintragen, the vouchers are created and you can export them via the Export Button
description:
KIS (Kundeninformationssystem (CIS Customer Information System) Birthday Voucher TV

18 August 2022

10:13

Table of Content

 

Cowis offers the so-called HIS (Customer Information System) as an optional module.

With this, a variety of evaluations are possible. But also customer loyalty programs with bonus vouchers and vouchers for birthdays, for example.

title: Login - new password is not working
text: Cowis has a restriction in the length of the password of 10 characters. "BUT", when you change the password initially, you can enter more than 10 characters, but Cowis cuts off anything beyond 10 characters. If the customer can't log in with their new password and says it's e.g. "password123456", then Cowis has cut it down to "password12". The 3456 have been removed.

title: New sales assistants - transfer to POS / Update demo mode
text: Wenn wir oder der Kunde neue Verkäufer angelegt haben, müssen diese über die Lerndatei in das POS übertragen werden. Der gleiche Vorgang muss durchgeführt werden, wenn der Kunde einen aktuellen Demomodus anfordert, der aktuelle Daten enthalten soll. Das Erstellen und Hochladen einer Lerndatei kann sehr zeitaufwändig sein (mehrere Stunden), die Kasse kann während dieses Prozesses nicht genutzt werden. Zuerst muss in der Warenwirtschaft eine neue Lerndatei erstellt werden -> Kassenabschlüsse -> Extras -> Sonstiges -> Lerndatei erstellen Datei vom Server auf den Kassen-PC kopieren (Zwischenlagern auf eigenem PC) In Kasse anmelden und Lerndatei in die Kasse importieren. Kasse neustarten und "Ja" drücken, wenn gefragt wird "Neue Stammdaten Übernehmen?"

title: Release/Restore Settlement Period, Cash Transaction
text: If the question "Do you want to print now?" is answered with "No" when creating a cash transaction, the settlement period is essentially burned and cannot be released again by our customer. These burned settlement periods are not marked in the overview with an asterisk (newly created) or with an "A" (completed), and they also do not have a financial number. Consequently, they cannot be found under Cowis -> Fibu Interface. A settlement period can only be restored by us: Log in with cowsys. Cowis -> Cash register closures -> Extras -> Cash transactions income & expenses -> Edit. Select the corresponding cash register and period. Cowis -> Cash register closures -> Extras -> Cash transactions income & expenses -> Close period -> Ok. The cash register closure is now released again and can be completed by the customer. Remind the customer again that they MUST click "Yes" when asked, "Do you want to print now?"
description:
If the question "Do you want to print now?" is answered with "No" when creating a cash transaction, the settlement period is essentially burned and cannot be released again by our customer. These burned settlement periods are not marked in the overview with an asterisk (newly created) or with an "A" (completed), and they also do not have a financial number. Consequently, they cannot be found under Cowis -> Fibu Interface.

A settlement period can only be restored by us:

  1. Log in with cowsys.

  2. Cowis -> Cash register closures -> Extras -> Cash transactions income & expenses -> Edit.



  3. Select the corresponding cash register and period.

  4. Cowis -> Cash register closures -> Extras -> Cash transactions income & expenses -> Close period -> Ok.

The cash register closure is now released again and can be completed by the customer.

  1. Remind the customer again that they MUST click "Yes" when asked, "Do you want to print now?"

text: Reports - sorting / Berichte - sortierte Cowis.net -> Auswertung -> Klassische Auswertungen -> F5 Key or New (Neu) -> Stock Incoming and Outgoing / Lager Warenein- und Ausgang Choose mask (Maske) (if existst), Date (Datum) and Filter (Aufschlüsselung) Filter (Aufschlüsselung) on ID = Artikel ID or BL = Ordernumber (Bestellnummer) by clicking the arrow. If customer only wants to see one supplier (Lieferant), then select the relevant article selection via the tab (Reiter) above. Click OK to accept changes. Change the title of the List (if necessary) Click OK. This returns you to the first page, where the List will be calculated. This can take awhile. The list opens and can either be saved, printed or just closed again.

title: Gelöschte Artikel wiederherstellen
text: F: Können gelöschte Artikel in der Warenwirtschaft wiederhergestellt werden? A: Ja, das können wir machen. Der Kunde muss wissen, welchen Artikel er gelöscht hat. Als Cowsys anmelden System->Service->Zugriffslisten->Artikel Dem Kunden diese Meldung klarmachen: In der anschließenden Übersicht den Artikel finden (Nach Artikel-ID suchen) und auswählen Auf "Ändern" klicken Zwei Mal die Taste "Enter" klicken In der Spalte "Gelöscht" angekommen, die Taste "Leerzeichen" klicken. Der Haken wird damit entfernt. So oft "Enter" klicken bis die Zeile durchgeklickt ist Mit F2 speichern 9. Kunde ggf. nochmals darauf hinweisen dass er die Herstellerbarcodes wieder hinterlegen muss. Kunde auch darauf hinweisen dass er gucken soll ob der Bestand stimmt und falls nicht den Kunden bitten eine Bestandskorrektur vorzunehmen.
description:
F: Können gelöschte Artikel in der Warenwirtschaft wiederhergestellt werden?

 

A: Ja, das können wir machen. Der Kunde muss wissen, welchen Artikel er gelöscht hat.

 

  1. Als Cowsys anmelden
  2. System->Service->Zugriffslisten->Artikel

 

  1. Dem Kunden diese Meldung klarmachen:
      

 

  1. In der anschließenden Übersicht den Artikel finden (Nach Artikel-ID suchen) und auswählen
  2. Auf "Ändern" klicken
  3. Zwei Mal die Taste "Enter" klicken
  4. In der Spalte "Gelöscht" angekommen, die Taste "Leerzeichen" klicken. Der Haken wird damit entfernt.
  5. So oft "Enter" klicken bis die Zeile durchgeklickt ist
  6. Mit F2 speichern


9. Kunde ggf. nochmals darauf hinweisen dass er die Herstellerbarcodes wieder hinterlegen muss.


Kunde auch darauf hinweisen dass er gucken soll ob der Bestand stimmt und falls nicht den Kunden bitten eine Bestandskorrektur vorzunehmen.

title: Sales (Numbers) are empty
text: Sales (Numbers) are empty Artikel -> Extras -> Sonstiges -> Verkäufe zurücksetzen This means that at this point in time, the display of the sold items in Cowis are set to zero (0) in the articles and Cowis will in principle re-extrapolate the sales figures from today, but only for display purposes. And if you then go to Extras -> Other, you can display Verkäufe gesamt (total sales) or Verkäufe ab (sales from) e.g. 06.04. (or the date when you reset the sales).
description:
Sales (Numbers) are empty

 

Artikel -> Extras -> Sonstiges -> Verkäufe zurücksetzen

 

 

This means that at this point in time, the display of the sold items in Cowis are set to zero (0) in the articles and Cowis will in principle re-extrapolate the sales figures from today, but only for display purposes.

 

And if you then go to Extras -> Other, you can display Verkäufe gesamt (total sales) or Verkäufe ab (sales from) e.g. 06.04. (or the date when you reset the sales).

title: Special prices - edit (more than one item at a time)
text: Special prices - edit (more than one item at a time) Backoffice (Warenwirtschaft) -> Artikel -> click/highlight the article that needs a special price Extras -> Book (Buchen) -> Edit Prices (Preise bearbeiten) Änderungsbezug (Change reference): What is the change? Special price? Something else? Choose here. Preisänderung in % (Price change in %): Should the price be changed as a percentage? Specify it here. Rundungsverfahren (Rounding procedure): Should the price be rounded up or down? Specify here. Neuer Preis (absolut) (New price (absolute)): Should the price simply be set to a new amount instead of being calculated as a %? Then specify here. Sonderpreis gilt ab dem (Special price is valid from): When does the special price start? Bis einschließlich den (Up to and including): Until when should the special price apply? (If permanent, then just leave blank)) Sonderpreis löschen (Delete special price): Should a special price be deleted? Then remove tick here and press OK. Etiketten generieren (Generate labels): Set tick here if labels are to be generated. Press OK.
description:
Special prices - edit (more than one item at a time)

 

Backoffice (Warenwirtschaft) -> Artikel -> click/highlight the article that needs a special price

 

Extras -> Book (Buchen) -> Edit Prices (Preise bearbeiten)

 

 

 

 

 

  1. Änderungsbezug (Change reference): What is the change? Special price? Something else? Choose here.
  2. Preisänderung in % (Price change in %): Should the price be changed as a percentage? Specify it here.
  3. Rundungsverfahren (Rounding procedure): Should the price be rounded up or down? Specify here.
  4. Neuer Preis (absolut) (New price (absolute)): Should the price simply be set to a new amount instead of being calculated as a %? Then specify here.
  5. Sonderpreis gilt ab dem (Special price is valid from): When does the special price start?
  6. Bis einschließlich den (Up to and including): Until when should the special price apply? (If permanent, then just leave blank))
  7. Sonderpreis löschen (Delete special price): Should a special price be deleted? Then remove tick here and press OK.
  8. Etiketten generieren (Generate labels): Set tick here if labels are to be generated.

 

Press OK.

title: Receipt: Change text
text: First, it is best to make a backup of the existing forms: Cowiskasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formulare aus-/einlagern Auslagern Alle OK Dateiname FORMULARE.TXT anpassen wie mit Datum versehene C:\COWIS\CowisKasse\DATEN\FORMULARE_11102022.TXT Speichern -> Forms are saved View receipt in cash register: Funktion->System->Formular-Verwaltung->"Verkauf" auswählen->Auf den "Formular"-Button klicken Here you can also type in a standard text that is then printed on every receipt. However, parameters come into play for everything that needs to be customised for each receipt. These can be customised as follows: Warenwirtschaft öffnen -> Kassenabschlüsse -> Einstellungen -> Alle Kassen -> Alle Parameter -> Suchen -> "KaDpText..." -> auf die Zeile klicken, die man ändern möchten -> spezifische Kasse oder alle Kassen rechts auswählen -> Text im Textfeld rechts ändern -> Übernehmen -> OK Warenwirtschaft->Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Datenaustausch Festplatte Restart the POS system. The text on the receipts should now have changed to the new text.
description:
First, it is best to make a backup of the existing forms:

Cowiskasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formulare aus-/einlagern
Auslagern
Alle
 OK

Dateiname FORMULARE.TXT anpassen wie mit Datum versehene
C:\COWIS\CowisKasse\DATEN\FORMULARE_11102022.TXT
 Speichern

-> Forms are saved

View receipt in cash register:

Funktion->System->Formular-Verwaltung->"Verkauf" auswählen->Auf den "Formular"-Button klicken

Here you can also type in a standard text that is then printed on every receipt. However, parameters come into play for everything that needs to be customised for each receipt. These can be customised as follows:



  1. Warenwirtschaft öffnen -> Kassenabschlüsse -> Einstellungen -> Alle 

 

 

  1. Kassen -> Alle Parameter -> Suchen -> "KaDpText..." -> auf die Zeile klicken, die man ändern möchten -> spezifische Kasse oder alle Kassen rechts auswählen -> Text im Textfeld rechts ändern -> Übernehmen -> OK

 

 

 

  1. Warenwirtschaft->Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Datenaustausch Festplatte

  2. Restart the POS system. The text on the receipts should now have changed to the new text.

title: Update BO (Warenwirtschaft)
text: Update BO (Warenwirtschaft) Before the update can be done, you should make certain that all users are signed out of Cowis. This also goes for EDI, DFÜ, Online shop etc. You can check this under Service Informationen -> Angemeldete Benutzer (Signed-in users) Services etc. You can find in Windows under Services and under Taskplanner. Then sign in and click System Then Update -> Update online einlesen (Online update install) If no warnings are shown, click Start The update is downloaded and installed. Click OK, then restart Backoffice (Warenwirtschaft) If the update has changed something in the database, you are asked if the database should be updated as well. This you agree to.
description:
Update BO (Warenwirtschaft)

 

Before the update can be done, you should make certain that all users are signed out of Cowis. This also goes for EDI, DFÜ, Online shop etc.

 

  1. You can check this under Service Informationen -> Angemeldete Benutzer (Signed-in users)

 

 

  1. Services etc. You can find in Windows under Services and under Taskplanner.

 

  1. Then sign in and click System

 

 

 

  1. Then Update -> Update online einlesen (Online update install)

 

 

  1. If no warnings are shown, click Start

 

 

  1. The update is downloaded and installed.

 

 

 

  1. Click OK, then restart Backoffice (Warenwirtschaft)

 

 

  1. If the update has changed something in the database, you are asked if the database should be updated as well. This you agree to.

title: Abrechnungszeitraum erstellen (Kassenbuchung)
text: Folgende Schritte werden von Tobias auch geschult: Cowis->Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Bearbeiten Entsprechende Kasse auswählen, anschließend öffnet sich die Übersicht der Abrechnungszeiträume "Neu"->Name für den Zeitraum eintragen->"Von" und "bis" eintragen (Optimalerweise 1 Monat)->Solange "Enter"-Taste drücken bis "Weiteren Datensatz anlegen?" erscheint->mit "Nein" beantworten Doppelklick auf den erstellten Zeitraum und im anschließenden Pop-up Fenster "Ja" klicken Die Belege werden nun bearbeitet, was sich auch in der Zeile unten einsehen lässt. Dies kann einige Minuten dauern. Nach abgeschlossener Bearbeitung öffnet sich ein Fenster->"Zurück" klicken Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Zeitraum abschließen->Ok->Ja Abrechnungsnummer bestätigen Druckvorschau schließen "Möchten Sie jetzt drucken" UNBEDINGT mit "Ja" beantworten. Ansonsten muss der Abrechnungszeitraum durch uns freigegeben werden. Anschließende Fragen/Pop-up Fenster bestätigen/mit "Ja" beantworten Der Abrechnungszeitraum ist nun Abgeschlossen, was in der Übersicht im ersten Feld mit einem "A" ersichtlich ist. "*" bedeutet, dass der Abrechnungszeitraum erstellt ist, aber noch nicht abgeschlossen ist. Wenn weder "A" noch "*" angezeigt werden, ist der Abrechnungszeitraum verbrannt und muss durch uns freigegeben werden. Abgeschlossene Abrechnungszeiträume lassen sich auch über das Cowis-Hauptmenü in der Fibu-Schnittstelle finden. In seltenen Fällen kommt es vor dass der Abrechnungszeitraum nicht an die Fibu-Schnittstelle übertragen wird, obwohl er richtig angelegt wurde. In diesem Fall: Kassenabschluss auswählen->Extras Fibu- Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen Ausgaben->Buch kompl. Rückgängig->Bestätigen Dann: Zeitraum wieder freigeben und Kasenbuch komplett löschen Mit Enter das Kassenbuch öffnen, alles markieren und löschen Und dann in der Übersicht den Abrechnungszeitraum auch löschen Und dann den Abrechnungszeitraum nochmals erstellen und übertragen.
description:
Folgende Schritte werden von Tobias auch geschult:


  

    1. Cowis->Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Bearbeiten

    1. Entsprechende Kasse auswählen, anschließend öffnet sich die Übersicht der Abrechnungszeiträume
    2. "Neu"->Name für den Zeitraum eintragen->"Von" und "bis" eintragen (Optimalerweise 1 Monat)->Solange "Enter"-Taste drücken bis "Weiteren Datensatz anlegen?" erscheint->mit "Nein" beantworten
    3. Doppelklick auf den erstellten Zeitraum und im anschließenden Pop-up Fenster "Ja" klicken
    4. Die Belege werden nun bearbeitet, was sich auch in der Zeile unten einsehen lässt. Dies kann einige Minuten dauern.
    5. Nach abgeschlossener Bearbeitung öffnet sich ein Fenster->"Zurück" klicken
    6. Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Zeitraum abschließen->Ok->Ja
    7. Abrechnungsnummer bestätigen
    8. Druckvorschau schließen
    9. "Möchten Sie jetzt drucken" UNBEDINGT mit "Ja" beantworten. Ansonsten muss der Abrechnungszeitraum durch uns freigegeben werden.
    10. Anschließende Fragen/Pop-up Fenster bestätigen/mit "Ja" beantworten

 

Der Abrechnungszeitraum ist nun Abgeschlossen, was in der Übersicht im ersten Feld mit einem "A" ersichtlich ist.
"*" bedeutet, dass der Abrechnungszeitraum erstellt ist, aber noch nicht abgeschlossen ist.
Wenn weder "A" noch "*" angezeigt werden, ist der Abrechnungszeitraum verbrannt und muss durch uns freigegeben werden.

 

Abgeschlossene Abrechnungszeiträume lassen sich auch über das Cowis-Hauptmenü in der Fibu-Schnittstelle finden.


In seltenen Fällen kommt es vor dass der Abrechnungszeitraum nicht an die Fibu-Schnittstelle übertragen wird, obwohl er richtig angelegt wurde. In diesem Fall:

Kassenabschluss auswählen->Extras Fibu- Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen Ausgaben->Buch kompl. Rückgängig->Bestätigen

Dann:

Zeitraum wieder freigeben und Kasenbuch komplett löschen

Mit Enter das Kassenbuch öffnen, alles markieren und löschen

Und dann in der Übersicht den Abrechnungszeitraum auch löschen

Und dann den Abrechnungszeitraum nochmals erstellen und übertragen.

title: Wareneingang buchen: Falscher Vorgang
text: Wenn nach dieser Vorgehensweise Wareneingänge gebucht werden, werden nur die Artikelzahlen geändert: Artikel->Extras->Buchen / Preise bearbeiten->Wareneingang buchen Es fehlt: - Wareneingangskontrolle - Lieferschein - Orderbezug Daher ist diese Vorgehensweise nicht zu empfehlen. Manche Kunden machen es aber dennoch so, nur müssen sie sich halt bewusst sein, dass das nicht die korrekte Vorgehensweise ist. Besser ist es - und so wird es auch von uns geschult - Wareneingänge über "Wareneingang"->"Neu" anzulegen.
description:
Wenn nach dieser Vorgehensweise Wareneingänge gebucht werden, werden nur die Artikelzahlen geändert:

Artikel->Extras->Buchen / Preise bearbeiten->Wareneingang buchen


Es fehlt:


- Wareneingangskontrolle

- Lieferschein

- Orderbezug


Daher ist diese Vorgehensweise nicht zu empfehlen. Manche Kunden machen es aber dennoch so, nur müssen sie sich halt bewusst sein, dass das nicht die korrekte Vorgehensweise ist.

Besser ist es - und so wird es auch von uns geschult - Wareneingänge über "Wareneingang"->"Neu" anzulegen.

title: Query user passwords
text: Log in to Cowis as a Cowsys user and then go to the Articles area, for example There you call up Extras -> Execute SQL command With this command you can read users and passwords from the Cowis DB select [FldAgBeDtUser], [FldAgBeDtRemark], [FldAgBeDtPassword] from [dbo].[T980_AgBenutzer] you can narrow it down with the user input select * from T980_AgUser where FldAgBeDtUser = 'Lara' (Lara must then be replaced by the user name) Then only the password of the user is displayed
description:
Log in to Cowis as a Cowsys user and then go to the Articles area, for example 

There you call up Extras -> Execute SQL command


With this command you can read users and passwords from the Cowis DB 


 

  select [FldAgBeDtUser], [FldAgBeDtRemark], [FldAgBeDtPassword] from [dbo].[T980_AgBenutzer] 

 

you can narrow it down with the user input 

select * from T980_AgUser where FldAgBeDtUser = 'Lara' 

 (Lara must then be replaced by the user name) 


Then only the password of the user is displayed

title: When Cowis complains about an incorrect start date
text: Sometimes it happens that customers adjust the Windows system date of their computer, in most cases unintentionally. When Cowis is then started, Cowis remembers this incorrect date. When the error has been corrected, the correct start date must be set via a procedure. This function is only executed by Cowis.Net Support! Log in to Cowis.Net with the Super-Cowsys user. System -> Service -> Procedure -> _AgStratDatumSetz Exit Cowis, restart, no more message
description:
Sometimes it happens that customers adjust the Windows system date of their computer, in most cases unintentionally. 


When Cowis is then started, Cowis remembers this incorrect date.


When the error has been corrected, the correct start date must be set via a procedure.


This function is only executed by Cowis.Net Support!

Log in to Cowis.Net with the Super-Cowsys user. 

System -> Service -> Procedure -> _AgStratDatumSetz

Exit Cowis, restart, no more message

title: Merkmal für leichtere Sortierung
text: Artikel Bereich öffnen Einstellungen -> Standardeinstellungen -> Konfiguration Eigenschaften (Stichwörter) Neu wählen Auf Dropdown Liste drücken Benutzerdefiniert wählen Mit Tab auf Name springen und Name angeben, dann OK drücken Zurück zum Hauptmenü System anklicken Parameter -> COWIS-Parameter -> OK AtEigenschInZl im Suchfeld eingeben (oder Alle Parameter anklicken und danach suchen) Neue Eigenschaft (z.B. TEST) finden und abharken, dann ausserhalb der Liste drücken und Übernehmen drücken (sehr wichtig) und zu letzt Schlïessen. Cowis kurz schliessen und wieder öffnen. Artikel öffnen (die neue Zeile ist jetzt sichtbar) Einen Artikel ändern, der das neue Merkmal benutzen soll. TEST) -> OK Wert anklicken -> Zurück Speichern -> Zurück Zurück Jetzt kann man das Merkmal in der Liste sehen und beliebig danach sortieren.

title: Restore deleted article
text: Q: Is it possible to restore a deleted article in Cowis? A: Yes, we can do that. Der Kunde muss wissen, welchen Artikel er gelöscht hat. Als Cowsys anmelden System->Service->Zugriffslisten->Artikel Dem Kunden diese Meldung klarmachen: In der anschließenden Übersicht den Artikel finden (Nach Artikel-ID suchen) und auswählen Auf "Ändern" klicken Zwei Mal die Taste "Enter" klicken In der Spalte "Gelöscht" angekommen, die Taste "Leerzeichen" klicken. Der Haken wird damit entfernt. Mit F2 speichern 9. Kunde ggf. nochmals darauf hinweisen dass er die Herstellerbarcodes wieder hinterlegen muss.
description:
Q: Is it possible to restore a deleted article in Cowis? 

 

A: Yes, we can do that. Der Kunde muss wissen, welchen Artikel er gelöscht hat. 

 

  1. Als Cowsys anmelden 

  2. System->Service->Zugriffslisten->Artikel 

 

  1. Dem Kunden diese Meldung klarmachen: 
     

 

  1. In der anschließenden Übersicht den Artikel finden (Nach Artikel-ID suchen) und auswählen 

  2. Auf "Ändern" klicken 

  3. Zwei Mal die Taste "Enter" klicken 

  4. In der Spalte "Gelöscht" angekommen, die Taste "Leerzeichen" klicken. Der Haken wird damit entfernt. 

  5. Mit F2 speichern 

 
9. Kunde ggf. nochmals darauf hinweisen dass er die Herstellerbarcodes wieder hinterlegen muss.

title: Logic of cash register numbers and branches
text: In Cowis.Net merchandise management there are branches. Branches are the locations where the retailer sells its goods to the end customer. (Sometimes branches are also warehouses in which no end customer operations take place) The branches are included as master data Article file branches to find Branches must be created in numerical ascending order from 1 to XX, depending on the customer. If retail business takes place in a branch, the customer needs a cash register (Cowiskasse). These will be in Cash accounts file Cash registers created and managed. The best logic has been established that the cash register numbers are created with 4 digits starting with the letter K. If a customer uses 1 Cowi cash register in the 1st branch, the cash register gets the identifier K0011 (K stands for cash register). 00 are placeholders, the first number stands for the branch numbers, the 2nd number for the cash register number. For example, if the customer operates 3 cash registers in branch 1, these would be the numbers K0011 K0012 K0013 For example, if the customer has 20 branches and 1 cash register in each branch then the logic would look like this K0011 ... K0051 ... (for the first checkout in the fifth branch) K0201 for the first cash register in the twentieth branch) If there were a 2nd or 3rd cash register in branch 19, that would be it K0191 K0192 K0193 Since the introduction of the TSE in Germany, it can happen that a customer only has 1 cash register in a store, but this cash register still has an identifier such as K0012. This can happen because the original K0011 cash register is irreparably lost due to a hardware crash, for example. In such a case, the defective cash register MUST be deactivated and a new cash register ID assigned. The TSE of the old cash register must also be deactivated.

Since the introduction of the TSE in Germany, it can happen that a customer only has 1 cash register in a store, but this cash register still has an identifier such as K0012.

This can happen because the original K0011 cash register is irreparably lost due to a hardware crash, for example. In such a case, the defective cash register MUST be deactivated and a new cash register ID assigned.

The TSE of the old cash register must also be deactivated.

title: How do you deactivate the TSE at a cash register?
text: If a cash register has to be taken out of service, the TSE must be deactivated. To do this, log in to Cowis.Net Backoffice with the Cowsys Administrator user. Cash Closings -> File -> Cash Registers Select the cash register to be deactivated with Change, then you select the API version (see screenshot) Click on “Deactivate TSE” Confirm the security query with “Yes” Confirms the message that no errors have occurred with OK and the TSE is deactivated.
description:
If a cash register has to be taken out of service, the TSE must be deactivated.

To do this, log in to Cowis.Net Backoffice with the Cowsys Administrator user.



Cash Closings -> File -> Cash Registers

Select the cash register to be deactivated with Change,

then you select the API version (see screenshot)


Click on “Deactivate TSE”


Confirm the security query with “Yes”


Confirms the message that no errors have occurred with OK and the TSE is deactivated.

title: How can you create payment methods?
text: To create payment methods for the cash register, go to Cowi's back office in System -> Parameters -> Payment methods As is usual in the Cowis.Net back office, you can create a new payment method with F5 or New Meaning of the individual fields: Name: Name of the payment method displayed at the checkout (max. 10 characters) Sorting: Where in the payment method list at the checkout the payment method appears Display: whether the payment method should even be displayed at the checkout Sales: defines whether the payment method at the checkout generates sales or not Bank: Whether the payment method can be used for bank deposits, usually only cash, i.e. euros or possible foreign currencies such as CHF (Swiss francs) Account number: If another account should be addressed instead of the general account in the transfer to financial accounting (usually not used) Telecash: Whether the payment method should be transferred to a PT (pay terminal) connected to the checkout Withdrawal: Whether payment should be possible using this payment method in the event of an exchange. Usually cash and voucher, sometimes handover to a PT
description:
To create payment methods for the cash register, go to Cowi's back office in System -> Parameters -> Payment methods


As is usual in the Cowis.Net back office, you can create a new payment method with F5 or New


Meaning of the individual fields:

Name: Name of the payment method displayed at the checkout (max. 10 characters)

Sorting: Where in the payment method list at the checkout the payment method appears

Display: whether the payment method should even be displayed at the checkout

Sales: defines whether the payment method at the checkout generates sales or not

Bank: Whether the payment method can be used for bank deposits, usually only cash, i.e. euros or possible foreign currencies such as CHF (Swiss francs)

Account number: If another account should be addressed instead of the general account in the transfer to financial accounting (usually not used)

Telecash: Whether the payment method should be transferred to a PT (pay terminal) connected to the checkout

Withdrawal: Whether payment should be possible using this payment method in the event of an exchange. Usually cash and voucher, sometimes handover to a PT

title: Customer claims: Evaluation is incorrect, what should I do?
text: A customer claims that the Lager-WE-WA evaluation does not show plausible values for delivered parts. For better comprehensibility of what follows, we have limited ourselves to 1 article (24092). We have booked a goods receipt on January 1st, 2024 with 100 parts, divided into sizes. The warehouse, goods incoming and outgoing evaluation shows the 100 pieces out as delivered. Later, the customer creates an evaluation and receives, for example, these numbers. Why is the number delivered reduced by 50? Because the user has booked a return to the supplier, for example. Outgoings from the store reduce the delivered quantity for returns (RT) and store outgoings/transfers from the store (FA). The goods movement log can usually help in classic evaluations You can recognize this using the WB (goods movement log). 100 delivered 50 returned 20 booked out as branch relocation Resulting in 30 pieces as delivered
description:
A customer claims that the Lager-WE-WA evaluation does not show plausible values for delivered parts.


For better comprehensibility of what follows, we have limited ourselves to 1 article (24092).


We have booked a goods receipt on January 1st, 2024 with 100 parts, divided into sizes.




The warehouse, goods incoming and outgoing evaluation shows the 100 pieces out as delivered.


Later, the customer creates an evaluation and receives, for example, these numbers.



Why is the number delivered reduced by 50?

Because the user has booked a return to the supplier, for example.

Outgoings from the store reduce the delivered quantity for returns (RT) and store outgoings/transfers from the store (FA).




The goods movement log can usually help in classic evaluations


You can recognize this using the WB (goods movement log).

100 delivered

50 returned

20 booked out as branch relocation

Resulting in 30 pieces as delivered

title: Print view in Warenwirtschaft: Font much too large
text: If the print view in Back Office looks like this: Windows manages the default printer itself, i.e. the last printer used is set as the default. So if you want to print a list in Back Office after printing labels, the list may come out as shown in the screenshot above The solution: In the Windows printer settings, change the standard printer to the A4 printer and switch off the "Windows manages standard printers" function:

title: Abrechnungszeitraum freigeben
text: Wenn beim Erstellen einer Kassenbuchung die Frage "Möchten Sie jetzt drucken?" mit "Nein" beantwortet wird, ist der Abrechnungszeitraum quasi verbrannt und kann von unserem Kunden nicht wieder freigegeben werden. Diese verbrannten Abrechnungszeiträume sind In der Übersicht weder mit einem Sternchen (neu angelegt) noch mit einem A (Abgeschlossen) markiert und haben auch keine Fibu-Nummer. Folglich ist er auch nicht unter Cowis->Fibu-Schnittstelle zu finden Ein Abrechnungszeitraum kann nur durch uns wiederhergestellt werden: 1. Mit cowsys anmelden 2. Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Bearbeiten 3. Entsprechende Kasse und Zeitraum auswählen 4. Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Zeitraum abschließen->Ok Der Kassenabschluss ist nun wieder freigegeben und kann vom Kunden abgeschlossen werden. 1. Kunde nochmals darauf hinweisen, dass er bei der Frage "Möchten Sie jetzt drucken?" auf "Ja" drücken MUSS In seltenen Fällen kommt es vor dass der Abrechnungszeitraum nicht an die Fibu-Schnittstelle übertragen wird, obwohl er richtig angelegt wurde. In diesem Fall: Kassenabschluss auswählen->Extras Fibu- Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen Ausgaben->Buch kompl. Rückgängig->Bestätigen Dann: Zeitraum wieder freigeben und Kasenbuch komplett löschen Mit Enter das Kassenbuch öffnen, alles markieren und löschen Und dann in der Übersicht den Abrechnungszeitraum auch löschen Und dann den Abrechnungszeitraum nochmals erstellen und übertragen.
description:
Wenn beim Erstellen einer Kassenbuchung die Frage "Möchten Sie jetzt drucken?" 

mit "Nein" beantwortet wird, ist der Abrechnungszeitraum quasi verbrannt und kann von

unserem Kunden nicht wieder freigegeben werden. Diese verbrannten Abrechnungszeiträume sind

In der Übersicht weder mit einem Sternchen (neu angelegt) noch mit einem A (Abgeschlossen) markiert 

und haben auch keine Fibu-Nummer. Folglich ist er auch nicht unter Cowis->Fibu-Schnittstelle zu finden


Ein Abrechnungszeitraum kann nur durch uns wiederhergestellt werden:


    1. Mit cowsys anmelden

    2. Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Bearbeiten

    3. Entsprechende Kasse und Zeitraum auswählen

    4. Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Zeitraum abschließen->Ok

    

Der Kassenabschluss ist nun wieder freigegeben und kann vom Kunden abgeschlossen werden.


    1. Kunde nochmals darauf hinweisen, dass er bei der Frage "Möchten Sie jetzt drucken?" auf "Ja" drücken MUSS

In seltenen Fällen kommt es vor dass der Abrechnungszeitraum nicht an die Fibu-Schnittstelle übertragen wird, obwohl er richtig angelegt wurde. In diesem Fall:

Kassenabschluss auswählen->Extras Fibu- Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen Ausgaben->Buch kompl. Rückgängig->Bestätigen

Dann:

Zeitraum wieder freigeben und Kasenbuch komplett löschen

Mit Enter das Kassenbuch öffnen, alles markieren und löschen

Und dann in der Übersicht den Abrechnungszeitraum auch löschen

Und dann den Abrechnungszeitraum nochmals erstellen und übertragen.

title: size-related prices
text: Most of the time, items and models have the same prices. There is a note in the article master if models have different prices. For example, in Goods Receipt there is not enough space in the column name to write "size-related", which is why an asterisk (*) is only displayed after the EK and the VK. It looks like this in the article master the content of the mask varies depending on the system configuration If you go to the Purchase Prices and/or Sales Prices tab, you can see the different prices.

title: Daily closing deleted in Cowis.Net back office...and now??
text: A user accidentally or unknowingly deleted a daily closing in Cowis.Net Backoffice. How do you restore this? (For a better understanding, simulate the entire process using a practical example) We have a daily closing (or TA for short) in Cowis.Net Bakcoffice in the cash closings area. (Here in the example we take the TA with the serial number 25.) To see what's behind it, let's first take a look at the journal: Print -> special -> journal -> optimized printout We also look at the goods movement log for that day Evaluations -> classic evaluations -> New -> goods movement log After these preparations (which only serve to understand what is happening) we delete the TA. We go to the TA in the cash statements, press delete and answer the security query with yes We now see that the serial number 25 no longer exists. However, NOT all bookings for the TA deletion have been removed from the goods movement log. So we now have a customer who has deleted a TA and is asking us for help. The first step is to export the missing TA from the Cowiskasse. To do this, we go to the relevant Cowiskassen software, log in as a service and select “Day-Final Backup” in the system menu. Select Export Select the day (TA) that is missing in Cowis.Net Backoffice (here the serial number 25) Click OK specify a storage location and a "speaking" name The TA has now been saved locally on the PC on which the Cowiskasse is installed. This created file must now be transferred to the Cowis.Net back office, e.g. by copying it to your support workstation computer via Teamviewer and then to the Cowis computer .Net Backoffice copied to the "Data" folder. (You can also create your own folder below the “Data” folder, e.g. “TA_restore” or another name.) Now you log in to the Cowis.Net back office with the Cowsys user and go to cash accounts Extras Consistency check XML import missing daily closings Then you look in the directory for the TA that was transferred from the Cowiskasse to the Cowis.Net back office, select it and click open Then you get this message A check of the goods movement log shows whether everything is in order.
description:
A user accidentally or unknowingly deleted a daily closing in Cowis.Net Backoffice.


How do you restore this?

(For a better understanding, simulate the entire process using a practical example)


We have a daily closing (or TA for short) in Cowis.Net Bakcoffice in the cash closings area.

(Here in the example we take the TA with the serial number 25.)


To see what's behind it, let's first take a look at the journal:

Print -> special -> journal -> optimized printout

We also look at the goods movement log for that day

Evaluations -> classic evaluations -> New -> goods movement log


After these preparations (which only serve to understand what is happening) we delete the TA.

We go to the TA in the cash statements, press delete and answer the security query with yes


We now see that the serial number 25 no longer exists.


However, NOT all bookings for the TA deletion have been removed from the goods movement log.



So we now have a customer who has deleted a TA and is asking us for help.


The first step is to export the missing TA from the Cowiskasse.

To do this, we go to the relevant Cowiskassen software, log in as a service and select “Day-Final Backup” in the system menu.


Select Export



Select the day (TA) that is missing in Cowis.Net Backoffice (here the serial number 25)



Click OK

specify a storage location and a "speaking" name


The TA has now been saved locally on the PC on which the Cowiskasse is installed. This created file must now be transferred to the Cowis.Net back office, e.g. by copying it to your support workstation computer via Teamviewer and then to the Cowis computer .Net Backoffice copied to the "Data" folder.


(You can also create your own folder below the “Data” folder, e.g. “TA_restore” or another name.)



Now you log in to the Cowis.Net back office with the Cowsys user and go to cash accounts

Extras

Consistency check

XML import missing daily closings

Then you look in the directory for the TA that was transferred from the Cowiskasse to the Cowis.Net back office, select it and click open


Then you get this message


A check of the goods movement log shows whether everything is in order.

title: Transfer item to cash register again
text: If a customer complains that items are available in the Cowis back office, but cannot be cashed at the checkout, troubleshooting is unnecessary, since the error cannot be found in the data transfer anyway. The solution would be a learn file, but this is very time consuming. Instead, Cowis offers the possibility to transfer articles to the cash register again. One marks in Cowis.Net -> area articles the desired articles (one can sort e.g. dnach last WE date and then e.g. the last month or time span X the articles mark. Then go to Area-> System -> Service -> Service Procedures -> enter the Cowis Super USer password (c0w15!) -> search for the procedure "POS". Confirms the messages with YES Then either performs a data exchange or waits at RemoteDFÜ Then everything should be good again
description:
If a customer complains that items are available in the Cowis back office, but cannot be cashed at the checkout, troubleshooting is unnecessary, since the error cannot be found in the data transfer anyway.  

  

The solution would be a learn file, but this is very time consuming.   

  

Instead, Cowis offers the possibility to transfer articles to the cash register again.  

  

One marks in Cowis.Net -> area articles the desired articles (one can sort e.g. dnach last WE date and then e.g. the last month or time span X the articles mark.  

  

Then go to Area-> System -> Service -> Service Procedures -> enter the Cowis Super USer password (c0w15!) -> search for the procedure "POS". 
 

 

 

 


Confirms the messages with YES 

 


Then either performs a data exchange or waits at RemoteDFÜ 

 


Then everything should be good again

title: different price groups
text: Normally an item has 1 selling price that applies to all branches. If a user (customer) wants to have several sales prices, it must first be defined whether the price group should be with or without VAT. This is what you set: Items -> Settings -> Default Settings -> Wholesale Defaults The prices of the different price groups are maintained in the article area via “Graded prices”

title: Item shows an inappropriate inventory
text: Sometimes the inventory display in the item list does not match the inventory in the item itself. (see screenshot) Here, an inventory of minus 9 is shown in the list, but a positive inventory is shown in the item itself. One way to fix this is the so-called consistency check. Here, Cowis goes through the bookings for the article and fixes "inconsistent" database entries. You log in to the customer's Cowis.Net back office with COWSYS. You switch to the article area You mark the affected article Then go to the "Area" menu item in the article area System Service Check data consistency (article only) You may get a message: This procedure (KuBrockArtRep) can and may only be carried out if no other user is logged in to Cowis. However, to carry out the data consistency check, this procedure (KuBrockArtRep) can be skipped if you click "Yes". In any case, ONLY the marked article may be checked. If you activate ALL of them, this can lead to Cowis.Net being down for several hours! At the end of the check and correction, the first thing you will receive is this message After clicking OK, the log is displayed, which you can close. Finally, check whether the display of the article stocks is consistent again. If so, the task is completed. If not, you must agree with the customer that the issue needs to be analyzed in more detail.
description:
Sometimes the inventory display in the item list does not match the inventory in the item itself. (see screenshot)

Here, an inventory of minus 9 is shown in the list, but a positive inventory is shown in the item itself.



One way to fix this is the so-called consistency check.

Here, Cowis goes through the bookings for the article and fixes "inconsistent" database entries.



You log in to the customer's Cowis.Net back office with COWSYS.

You switch to the article area

You mark the affected article

Then go to the "Area" menu item in the article area


System

Service

Check data consistency (article only)


You may get a message:

This procedure (KuBrockArtRep) can and may only be carried out if no other user is logged in to Cowis. However, to carry out the data consistency check, this procedure (KuBrockArtRep) can be skipped if you click "Yes".


In any case, ONLY the marked article may be checked. If you activate ALL of them, this can lead to Cowis.Net being down for several hours!


At the end of the check and correction, the first thing you will receive is this message


After clicking OK, the log is displayed, which you can close.


Finally, check whether the display of the article stocks is consistent again. If so, the task is completed.


If not, you must agree with the customer that the issue needs to be analyzed in more detail.

title: Can every item be transferred from one store to another?
text: Yes, but the chargeback must then be carried out manually (be sure to point this out to the customer!) Normally all goods are allocated to a specific store Normally the customer can carry out stock transfers themselves Log in as cowsys->System->Service->Procedure->_AtAutoFilialUmbu->OK->Read through->OK->Select issuing store->Select posting store->Enter posting date->OK->Then you get a stock transfer list->You can save it as a PDF and save it on the desktop with a comprehensible file name->Close print preview->Do you want to transfer stock?>Yes>Execute data exchange (both in Wawi and with batch file) If you now filter by store in the article overview, you can see that there are no more positive stocks in one store->everything has been transferred If the customer then wants to post this back again, the easiest way to do this is via the cash register, must be done manually from: https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/49544

title: Deactivate TSE for a Cowiskasse
text: If a Cowis cash register is no longer used, you must deactivate the TSE for this cash register in the Cowis.Net back office. Log in to the Cowis.Net back office with Cowsys, navigate to Cash register closings -> File -> Cash registers There, select the cash register to be deactivated with Change (F7) Select V2 for the API version and then click on "Deactivate TSE" Confirm the warning message that follows with YES. If deactivation is successful, you will receive a message that the TSE is deactivated and the cash register must no longer be used under any circumstances.
description:
If a Cowis cash register is no longer used, you must deactivate the TSE for this cash register in the Cowis.Net back office.


Log in to the Cowis.Net back office with Cowsys, navigate to Cash register closings -> File -> Cash registers

There, select the cash register to be deactivated with Change (F7)


Select V2 for the API version and then click on "Deactivate TSE"


Confirm the warning message that follows with YES.

If deactivation is successful, you will receive a message that the TSE is deactivated and the cash register must no longer be used under any circumstances.

title: Meaning of an * in the Status column in the cash statements
text: The * in the Status column indicates that the user has viewed/printed the exception log for the relevant daily closing. (see also parameter "AusnProtPosGeloescht") The exception log is called up in the cash register closings area via Print -> Evaluations -> Exception log The exception log lists everything that by definition represents an exception to regular sales. This includes - Sales with zero inventory - Price reductions - Exchanges - Zero receipts - Issue receipts - Line and receipt breaks What is the exception log needed for? If an employee causes a lot of exceptions, such as line or receipt breaks, or unusually high price reductions, this can be a clue for an employee meeting. It is NOT the job of support to make assumptions about WHY an employee causes exceptions, support is only there to show the user how to create the exception log, interpretation is always a matter for the user. Examples of exception logs

title: Print preview of reports (A4) shows an incorrect size
text: If you are suddenly confronted with an unusual print preview in Cowis.Net Backoffice (see example) don't despair. You don't have to change anything in Cowis.Net!! Go to the Windows printer settings usually it is enough to click on the Windows start area and search for printer Look for the check mark for standard printer Change the standard printer to your regular standard printer Start printing again and enjoy an evaluation

title: How to deactivate a TSE
text: If a customer no longer actively uses a cash register, the TSE should (must) be deactivated in consultation with the customer. To do this, log in to the Cowis.Net back office with the COWSYS user Navigate to the cash register closings File Cash registers Select the cash register whose TSE is to be deactivated with a single click Select Change In the Fiskaly section, select version 2 (where it says "Initialized") from the drop-down menu Then select deactivate TSE You will be asked to deactivate it Click Yes You will receive a message that the TSE was deactivated without errors Then the TSE parameter for this cash register must be set to N. To do this, go to File -> Cash register parameters in the cash register closings Search for TSE in the window Find the parameter "TSEImplement" Select the relevant cash register and change the parameter from F for Fiskaly to N for Not active (deactivated) Invoice DE must then be informed of this
description:
If a customer no longer actively uses a cash register, the TSE should (must) be deactivated in consultation with the customer.


To do this, log in to the Cowis.Net back office with the COWSYS user


Navigate to the cash register closings

File

Cash registers

Select the cash register whose TSE is to be deactivated with a single click

Select Change


In the Fiskaly section, select version 2 (where it says "Initialized") from the drop-down menu




Then select deactivate TSE


You will be asked to deactivate it

Click Yes


You will receive a message that the TSE was deactivated without errors





Then the TSE parameter for this cash register must be set to N. To do this, go to File -> Cash register parameters in the cash register closings

Search for TSE in the window

Find the parameter "TSEImplement"

Select the relevant cash register and change the parameter from F for Fiskaly to N for Not active (deactivated)



Invoice DE must then be informed of this

title: Backup for development
text: sind Sie bitte so gut und senden Sie uns eine Datensicherung, damit die Entwicklung direkt mit Ihren Parametern und Einstellungen schauen kann. So senden Sie uns eine Datensicherung: Sie öffnen mit einem Internetbrowser diesen Link Transfer Now (https://www.transfernow.net/de) Nachdem Sie auf Start geklickt haben Navigieren Sie in Ihrem Windows Explorer zum Verzeichnis (Ordner) Backup innerhalb Ihres Cowis.Net Verzeichnisses, im Regelfall L:\Cowis.Net\Backup Hier wählen Sie dann das letzte (aktuellste) Backup aus, dies sollte das Datum vor dem heutigen Tag tragen Hier tragen Sie Ihre E-Mail Adresse ein Geben Ihren Absendernamen ein Klicken Sie anschließend auf das Schloss-Symbol (Im Screenshot rot eingekreist). Tragen Sie ein Passwort ein und klicken Sie auf "Bestätigen": Bei E-Mail des Empfängers tragen Sie bitte ein: Igor.Kyselov@k3btg.com Bei Betreff können Sie eintragen: Ihre Firmenname und Datensicherung Cowis Nachricht ist optional Dann klicken Sie auf Übertragen Wir erhalten dadurch eine Möglichkeit Ihre Datensicherung zu nutzen um das von Ihnen geschilderte Anliegen schneller und mit Ihren Daten zu analysieren Bitte teilen Sie uns das Passwort, das Sie in Transfernow eingetragen, als Antwort auf diese Nachricht mit. Sobald wir die Datei von Transfernow heruntergeladen haben, bekommen Sie eine E-Mail hierzu. Bitte löschen Sie die Datei anschliessend von Transfernow. Wir melden uns dann mit einem Ergebnis / Lösung

Nachdem Sie auf Start geklickt haben

Hier wählen Sie dann das letzte (aktuellste) Backup aus, dies sollte das Datum vor dem heutigen Tag tragen

Hier tragen Sie Ihre E-Mail Adresse ein
Geben Ihren Absendernamen ein

Klicken Sie anschließend auf das Schloss-Symbol (Im Screenshot rot eingekreist).

Tragen Sie ein Passwort ein und klicken Sie auf "Bestätigen":

Bei E-Mail des Empfängers tragen Sie bitte ein:
Igor.Kyselov@k3btg.com

Bei Betreff können Sie eintragen: Ihre Firmenname und Datensicherung Cowis
Nachricht ist optional
Dann klicken Sie auf Übertragen

Wir erhalten dadurch eine Möglichkeit Ihre Datensicherung zu nutzen um das von Ihnen geschilderte Anliegen schneller und mit Ihren Daten zu analysieren

Bitte teilen Sie uns das Passwort, das Sie in Transfernow eingetragen, als Antwort auf diese Nachricht mit.

Sobald wir die Datei von Transfernow heruntergeladen haben, bekommen Sie eine E-Mail hierzu. Bitte löschen Sie die Datei anschliessend von Transfernow.

Wir melden uns dann mit einem Ergebnis / Lösung

text: If the customer wants to delete colours, you have to share the Cowsys user and the Tagespassword with him. He then can delete the colours himself

title: Abrechnungszeitraum fehlt in der Fibu-Schnittstelle (obwohl er richtig angelegt wurde)
text: 1. Als cowsys anmelden 2. Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchunge Einnahmen & Ausgaben -> Bearbeiten 3. Kasse auswählen 4. Abrechnungszeitraum einmal anklicken (sodass dieser markiert ist) 5. Extras->Fibu - Kassenbuchunge Einnahmen Ausgaben -> Buch kompl. rückgängig 6. Abrechnungszeitraum freigeben (https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000280123?lang=en) 7. Mit Enter das Kassenbuch öffnen, alles markieren und löschen (sofern im Abrechnungszeitraum etwas drin ist) 8. Und dann in der Übersicht den Abrechnungszeitraum auch löschen 9. Abrechnungszeitraum neu erstellen (https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000186889?lang=en)
description:
1. Als cowsys anmelden

2. Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchunge Einnahmen & Ausgaben -> Bearbeiten


3. Kasse auswählen

4. Abrechnungszeitraum einmal anklicken (sodass dieser markiert ist)

5. Extras->Fibu - Kassenbuchunge Einnahmen Ausgaben -> Buch kompl. rückgängig


6. Abrechnungszeitraum freigeben (https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000280123?lang=en)


7. Mit Enter das Kassenbuch öffnen, alles markieren und löschen (sofern im Abrechnungszeitraum etwas drin ist)


8. Und dann in der Übersicht den Abrechnungszeitraum auch löschen


9. Abrechnungszeitraum neu erstellen (https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000186889?lang=en)

title: The importance of correctly creating an article
text: One of the most important article properties is the size The spelling of the article property is particularly important. There is no room for creativity here. There are specifications for the article properties that must be adhered to, otherwise there will be problems when printing labels (sizes are not printed) or exporting articles (sizes are not exported) The feature name may only contain the following values: - Size - Color - Cup - Length No deviations are permitted, including "size", "size", "sizes" or "length", all of which lead to problems. You can change the name afterwards, but finding the incorrectly created articles is time-consuming.
description:
One of the most important article properties is the size

The spelling of the article property is particularly important.


There is no room for creativity here.


There are specifications for the article properties that must be adhered to, otherwise there will be problems when printing labels (sizes are not printed) or exporting articles (sizes are not exported)


The feature name may only contain the following values:

- Size

- Color

- Cup

- Length


No deviations are permitted, including "size", "size", "sizes" or "length", all of which lead to problems.


You can change the name afterwards, but finding the incorrectly created articles is time-consuming.

title: Create a payment method for the Cowis cash register
text: To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office. Go to System Then to Parameters Select payment methods In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited) Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide) Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged) The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button Then you enter the values you want and save them
description:
To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office.

Go to System


Then to Parameters


Select payment methods


In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed


Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited)

Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register

Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide)

Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here

Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection

Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal

Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged)


The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange


A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button


Then you enter the values you want and save them

title: Time recording - correction - manual recording
text: If the working hours have been recorded in the Cowiskasse, they are transferred to the Cowis.Net back office via data exchange. The working hours can be found in the area "Cash register closings" -> File -> Time recording In this area it is possible to make corrections, delete entries or add them manually. (To what extent this is permissible under working hour law, please ask a legal advisor) Correct entry Select the entry to be corrected with a click and then select Change (or F7) The employee in this example has a verifiable start time of 7:55 a.m., so we change the 1st arrival entry of the day to the correct time. After you have selected Change (or F7), press Enter until you are in the TIME cell and change the entry to the correct time. Press Enter or save the entry with F2 or by clicking Save When the entry has been saved, #### appears in the booking type, this is a hint for the user to make a manual change. (You may need to adjust the cell width) You can also delete entries, select the entry to be deleted and use the F8 or Delete key. Enter entry If, for whatever reason, you are forced to enter an entry manually, proceed as follows. Select NEW (or F5) An empty line is created with the starting position on the personnel number Either you know the employee number or you use the drop-down function or press F9 (that stands for list) In this example, we only have 2 employees We now enter working hours for Mr. Völkner on October 29, 2024 from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. with a break from 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m. A total of 4 entries are required for this We select the seller and press Enter The initial approach is that Cowis.Net suggests "Go". As this makes no sense for the first booking, it is important for you to know that you can ONLY select the booking type using F9 or the drop-down menu. (Manually entering the word "Come" or "Go" has NO effect) So we select "Come" for Mr. Völkner We enter the date in the time-saving Cowis way with DDMM (without points and in the same year without a year, i.e. 2910) and press Enter We enter the time in the format HH:MM and press Enter Cowis.Net Office asks Create another data record (YES / No) We select YES and create the next data record, the start of the break We select the employee with the personnel number 1 again and press Enter Mr. Völkner went on break on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00, so we record a departure on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00 and when we press Enter Cowis.Net Backoffice asks whether the next data record should be recorded. We confirm this with Yes and then record the return from the break at 13:00 And to complete this manual recording, we record the final departure at 18:00 At the end of the manual recording, you have 4 entries (2 arrivals and 2 departures) And if you are unsure: do not hesitate to ask about a paid training course.
description:
If the working hours have been recorded in the Cowiskasse, they are transferred to the Cowis.Net back office via data exchange.


The working hours can be found in the area

"Cash register closings" -> File -> Time recording




In this area it is possible to make corrections, delete entries or add them manually.

(To what extent this is permissible under working hour law, please ask a legal advisor)



Correct entry

Select the entry to be corrected with a click and then select Change (or F7)


The employee in this example has a verifiable start time of 7:55 a.m., so we change the 1st arrival entry of the day to the correct time.


After you have selected Change (or F7), press Enter until you are in the TIME cell and change the entry to the correct time.



Press Enter or save the entry with F2 or by clicking Save


When the entry has been saved, #### appears in the booking type, this is a hint for the user to make a manual change. (You may need to adjust the cell width)


You can also delete entries, select the entry to be deleted and use the F8 or Delete key.



Enter entry

If, for whatever reason, you are forced to enter an entry manually, proceed as follows.


Select NEW (or F5)

An empty line is created with the starting position on the personnel number


Either you know the employee number or you use the drop-down function or press F9 (that stands for list)


In this example, we only have 2 employees



We now enter working hours for Mr. Völkner on October 29, 2024 from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. with a break from 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m.

A total of 4 entries are required for this


We select the seller and press Enter

The initial approach is that Cowis.Net suggests "Go".


As this makes no sense for the first booking, it is important for you to know that you can ONLY select the booking type using F9 or the drop-down menu. (Manually entering the word "Come" or "Go" has NO effect)

So we select "Come" for Mr. Völkner



We enter the date in the time-saving Cowis way with DDMM (without points and in the same year without a year, i.e. 2910) and press Enter


We enter the time in the format HH:MM and press Enter


Cowis.Net Office asks

Create another data record (YES / No)


We select YES and create the next data record, the start of the break

We select the employee with the personnel number 1 again and press Enter


Mr. Völkner went on break on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00, so we record a departure on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00 and when we press Enter Cowis.Net Backoffice asks whether the next data record should be recorded.

We confirm this with Yes and then record the return from the break at 13:00


And to complete this manual recording, we record the final departure at 18:00



At the end of the manual recording, you have 4 entries (2 arrivals and 2 departures)


And if you are unsure: do not hesitate to ask about a paid training course.

title: Time recording - evaluation - analysis
text: After you have recorded the working hours, the evaluation takes place. The evaluation of the time recording can either be done via the evaluations, or (which makes more sense) in the cash register closings (the evaluation is the same in both cases) We go into cash register closings Go to Print -> Evaluations -> Time recording You enter the date from - to and can go straight to OK without further ado The result is an overview list of all employees and their recorded working hours (In this example, only 2 days of 1 employee are recorded, we zoom in a bit) The times shown are net (i.e. breaks have already been deducted) The second option for the evaluation is the detailed evaluation per employee To do this, select in the "Print variant" field -> Individual salesperson. You will only see employees for whom working hours have been recorded This evaluation then looks like this If you have any questions or are unsure, please feel free to take advantage of our paid training offer.
