title: Selection by branches in the cash register closings
text: Previously (Cowis.Net version 6.4.60 before November 5, 2024) in the Cowis.Net back office cash register closings there was only the option of displaying all branches or selecting a specific branch from the drop-down menu of the quick filter. Sometimes it happened that users entered several branches separated by commas in order to filter. This led to the problem that the cash register closings program area could no longer be opened afterwards. From the Cowis.Net back office program version 6.4.60 from November 5th, 2024 or later, it is possible to select several branches by activating checkboxes in the cash register closings area.
description:
Previously (Cowis.Net version 6.4.60 before November 5, 2024) in the Cowis.Net back office cash register closings there was only the option of displaying all branches or selecting a specific branch from the drop-down menu of the quick filter.


Sometimes it happened that users entered several branches separated by commas in order to filter. This led to the problem that the cash register closings program area could no longer be opened afterwards.

From the Cowis.Net back office program version 6.4.60 from November 5th, 2024 or later, it is possible to select several branches by activating checkboxes in the cash register closings area.

title: Cash register closings can no longer be called up in the Cowis.Net back office
text: Customer reports that a certain Cowis user can no longer open the program item "Cash register closings". This is due to a specific user action that we are trying to prevent with the Cowis.Net back office version 6.4.60 from November 5th, 2024. What is the problem, or what did the user do: In the Cowis.Net back office version 6.4.60 up to November 5th, 2024, it was only possible to select (or filter) by branch in the cash register closings area using the drop-down menu This was the previous option for selection / filtering Now it sometimes happened that a user tried to list the branches separated by commas The result was that the user could no longer call up the cash register closings area. Cowis creates entries for these filters in the SQL database (in table 977). However, these commands cannot be called or executed by Cowis, which is why the "lockout" occurs. You have to log in as a COWSYS user in the Cowis.Net back office, then you can go to the cash register closings. There you call up the area for SQL execution via Tools -> Execute SQL command With a select command on table 977 you can see which entries are there, in which area they apply and which user is affected Here you can see that for the cash register closings area (or daily closings) there is an entry for the user "Chef" with the "selection" [1,2,4]. With this "clean command" you can cancel the entry for the branch selection. update T977_AgFilterZL set FldAgFzDtBedinung1 = '' where FldAgFzDtBedinung1 like '%,%' and FldAgFzDtBereich='Nr500_KaTagesabschluesse' The result is that the entry itself is still there, but the selection according to 1,2,4 has been removed. The user Chef can now access the cash register closings again. You exit Cowis once so that you are logged out as COWSYS and the case is closed !!If you don't know what you are doing, forward it to 2nd Line Support!!
description:
Customer reports that a certain Cowis user can no longer open the program item "Cash register closings".


This is due to a specific user action that we are trying to prevent with the Cowis.Net back office version 6.4.60 from November 5th, 2024.


What is the problem, or what did the user do:

In the Cowis.Net back office version 6.4.60 up to November 5th, 2024, it was only possible to select (or filter) by branch in the cash register closings area using the drop-down menu

This was the previous option for selection / filtering




Now it sometimes happened that a user tried to list the branches separated by commas


The result was that the user could no longer call up the cash register closings area.


Cowis creates entries for these filters in the SQL database (in table 977). However, these commands cannot be called or executed by Cowis, which is why the "lockout" occurs.



You have to log in as a COWSYS user in the Cowis.Net back office, then you can go to the cash register closings.

There you call up the area for SQL execution via


Tools -> Execute SQL command




With a select command on table 977 you can see which entries are there, in which area they apply and which user is affected




Here you can see that for the cash register closings area (or daily closings) there is an entry for the user "Chef" with the "selection" [1,2,4].



With this "clean command" you can cancel the entry for the branch selection.

update T977_AgFilterZL set FldAgFzDtBedinung1 = '' where FldAgFzDtBedinung1 like '%,%' and FldAgFzDtBereich='Nr500_KaTagesabschluesse'




The result is that the entry itself is still there, but the selection according to 1,2,4 has been removed.


The user Chef can now access the cash register closings again.


You exit Cowis once so that you are logged out as COWSYS and the case is closed


!!If you don't know what you are doing, forward it to 2nd Line Support!!

title: Export articles
text: You can export articles in Cowis.Net. This creates an "ArtExp.dat" file which you can then import into Excel, for example. We do not offer any support beyond creating the export file. You mark the articles you want to export in the Articles section. Then you go to System via Area Once you get there, go to Service -> Master data import/export -> Standard import/export There, switch to the "Export" tab Select the type of export -> activate the checkboxes you want to export and click OK The file is then saved in the selected target directory When opened with an editor, the file looks like this: Imported into Excel like this

title: Reset sales figures
text: Normally all sales figures are always displayed in Cowis.Net Backoffice. See screenshot There is a function in Cowis.Net Backoffice "Reset sales" (Article -> Extras -> Other -> Reset sales This resets the sales figures in the inventory management system. This does NOT mean that any turnover or sales are deleted, it is ONLY a "zeroing" of the sales figures displayed in the items area When you execute this function, you will be asked whether all articles or only the marked articles should be edited The number of sales from the day of the reset is then zero. This means that if you execute this function on March 6, 2025, you will see that the sales section is empty. Of course, all the sales figures are still there in the history and the evaluations. If you now go back to Articles -> Extras -> Other you can click on Total Sales Figures dann werden wieder alle seit Anbeginn verkauften Teile angezeigt If you go again to Articles -> Extras -> Other you can see that you can "switch on" that ONLY the sales figures since the date of the reset are displayed Why should So how do you reset sales? Some customers reset their sales figures on January 1st of each year so they can see what their current sales are, that's the only reason why you do it on schedule.

you can click on Total Sales Figures


dann werden wieder alle seit Anbeginn verkauften Teile angezeigt



If you go again to Articles -> Extras -> Other


you can see that you can "switch on" that ONLY the sales figures since the date of the reset are displayed




Why should So how do you reset sales?

Some customers reset their sales figures on January 1st of each year so they can see what their current sales are, that's the only reason why you do it on schedule.

title: Price Changes / Special Prices
text: To quickly and easily add special offers or other price changes to items, there is the "Automatic Price Change" feature. This can be found under Items -> Extras -> Booking / Edit Prices. First, select the items you want to add a special price (or price change). See also "Item Selection Options." Select the selected items (CTRL+a) or record -> select -> select all. Then go to Extras -> Book / Edit Prices -> Automatic Price Changes. If you receive a window with a currency query (customer-specific), select the appropriate currency. You will receive this window, in which you define the parameters for your desired price change. A field explanation can be found in a separate help article. In our example, we want to assign a special price to the selected item, which corresponds to a 30% reduction on the original selling price and is valid for the period June 15th - June 30th, 2025. (a duration is NOT mandatory, without a time specification the special price always applies until you remove it, with a date specification the special price only applies in this date range) After clicking OK, this window will appear, and the price change is complete. You can then uncheck the items. The special price will be displayed here, depending on your configuration. Otherwise, you can also find it in the item report list in the SP column.
